    • Uses of RemoteMethod in us.pserver.revok

      Methods in us.pserver.revok that return RemoteMethod 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RemoteMethod MethodChain.add(java.lang.String method)
      Add a RemoteMethod constructed with passed argument.
      RemoteMethod MethodChain.add(java.lang.String objname, java.lang.String method)
      Add a RemoteMethod constructed with passed arguments.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.addArg(java.lang.Object obj)
      Adds a method argument.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.addType(java.lang.Class cls)
      Adds a class type of a method argument.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.args(java.lang.Object... objs)
      Set the method arguments.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.clearArguments()
      Clear the argument list.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.clearTypes()
      Clear the list of classes of the method arguments.
      RemoteMethod MethodChain.current()
      Return the current RemoteMethod of the internal iterator.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.extractTypesFromArgs()
      Extract the types of method arguments (this method is imprecise and may cause invocation errors i.e: double/java.lang.Double).
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.forObject(java.lang.String objName)
      Set the object name.
      RemoteMethod MethodChain.lastAdded()
      Return the last RemoteMethod added.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.method(java.lang.String name)
      Set the method name.
      RemoteMethod MethodChain.next()
      Return the next element of the internal iterator.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.setCredentials(Credentials c)
      Set the authentication Credentials object with server.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.setReturnVar(java.lang.String var)
      Set a variable in the server which will receive the returned value of the method.
      RemoteMethod RemoteMethod.types(java.lang.Class... cls)
      Set the types of the method arguments.

    • Uses of RemoteMethod in us.pserver.revok.protocol

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void RunnableConnectionHandler.checkInputStreamReference(RemoteMethod rmt, Transport trp)
      Check for InputStream objects references in the remote method arguments, replacing these references for the embedded Http request InputStream content.
